result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron R Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
hearing 8/14/2014.

***** 8-25-14 Judge Pocan, Court ordered restitution in the amount of $19975.81, joint and several, owed to Radio Shack and payable as a condition of Extended Supervision. If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered. Restitution to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis. Stats before costs and surcharges *****

Court ordered  all costs, fees and surcharges imposed.  Up to 25% of prison funds may be applied.  If defendant fals to pay all and/or restitution before the end of the sentence, a civil judgment shall be entered.
*1/30/2017  DNA surcharge vacated.

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving four years of this sentence.
*1/30/2017  Sentence modified to/reduced to seven and a half (7 1/2 ) years consisting of four and a half (4 1/2) years of Initial Confinement and three (3) years of Extended Supervision.  Defendant shall be eligible for the Substance Abuse Program and Challenge Incarceration Prgoram after serving three and a half (3 1/2) years of his sentence.
Consecutive to: Consecutive with any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Radio Shack, Kamerec,Karari J.

Follow all rules of Extended supervision.
Coperate with any counseling deemed necessary.
AODA evaluation.  Follow through and successfully complete all recommended programs and treatment plans. Random urine testing. Absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, surcharge imposed.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon that he may never possess a firearm.

records.addlTxt: to and from Aaron Thomas, received and filed.
amended

Order filed and signed by the Court.  The defendant's sentence is modified as follows:  the sentence is reduced to seven and a half years of imprisonment, consisting of four and a half years initial confinement and three years of extended supervision.  The defendant shall be eligible for the Substance Abuse Program and the Challenge Incarceration Program after serving three and a half years of his sentence.  The DNA surcharge of $250 is vacated.  The judgment of conviction shall be amended accordingly.  Copies forwarded to parties.

HEARING

Defendant Aaron R Thomas in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Aaron R Thomas in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties stipulate to requested restitution amount.  Court ordered restitution in the amount of $19,975.81, joint and several, owed to Radio Shack and payable as a condition of Extended Supervision.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.  

Restitution to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis. Stats. before costs and surcharges.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM DODGE FOR PURPOSES OF THE RESTITUTION HEARING IN BRANCH 26.

Attorney Debra J. Patterson in court, Defendant Aaron R Thomas not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from Dodge for purposes of this hearing. Case adjourned for a Restitution Hearing in Branch 26.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.  Restitution hearing scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Aaron R Thomas in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

  Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence report reviewed. Statements made as to sentencing.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8  YEARS, CONSECUTIVE with any other sentence, with credit for 3  DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program  AFTER serving 4 years of this sentence.

The Court imposed the following conditions of extended supervision:  

- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause;
- Undergo an AODA evaluation; follow through and successfully complete all recommended programs and treatment plans;
- Random urine testing;
-Absolute sobriety
- Follow all rules of extended supervision
-Cooperate with any counseling deemed necessary
-Obtain and maintain employment
- Court ordered all costs, fees and surcharges IMPOSED. Up to 25% prison funds may be applied.  If the defendant fails to pay all cost, surcharges and/or restitution before the end of the sentence, a civil judgement shall be entered. 
-No Contact with: Radio Shack, Kamerec, Karari J.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank- Surcharge IMPOSED.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon that he may never possess a firearm.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.


RESTITUTIOn is to be determined on the next court date.
